definition: to cheat/to swindle/to deceive/to get on (a horse etc) by swinging one leg over

sentences.english: This year, there were no tricks and no serious injuries.
sentences.chinese: 今年的比賽沒有騙人把戲，也沒有人重傷。

sentences.english: There was all the usual humbug and obligatory compliments from ministers.
sentences.chinese: 全都是些部長們常說的騙人鬼話和少不了的奉承恭維。

sentences.english: The con artist bamboozled her out of $600.
sentences.chinese: 那騙人的老手騙走了她600美元。

sentences.english: It was the most honest moment of the entire investment discussion.
sentences.chinese: 這是整個投資討論中最沒辦法騙人的環節。

sentences.english: The gril who always trick others.
She enjoys doing other people down.
I have recognized so clearly, never feeling the mirror are deceptive.
sentences.chinese: 我已認不清自己，感覺鏡子裏的從來的都是騙人的。

sentences.english: Then Mozi's universal love is just blind talking?
sentences.chinese: 那墨家的兼愛豈不就是騙人騙己嗎？
你在騙人，我纔不信你呢。

sentences.english: Believe Exxon-Mobile’s misleading ads about energy stocks.
sentences.chinese: 你相信埃克森莫比爾公司關於能源股的騙人廣告嗎？

sentences.english: If you say you saw this one coming, you’re lying.
sentences.chinese: 如果你說你早就知道會這樣，那你肯定是騙人的。

sentences.english: Russia is flat-out lying to us during our nuclear treaty talks.
sentences.chinese: 美俄削減核兵器公約會談的時候俄羅斯完整是在騙人。

sentences.english: You cry to impose the E, fairy tales are lying.
sentences.chinese: 沵哭着対涐妁，童話裏都是騙人的。

sentences.english: He resigned rathan then took part in such a dishonest transaction.
sentences.chinese: 他寧願辭職也不參與這樣騙人的勾當。

sentences.english: Their resemblance to cuddly toys is a base deceit.
sentences.chinese: 酷似絨毛玩具讓人想抱在懷裏的外表根本就是騙人的。

sentences.english: Do people think he cheats? All the time.
sentences.chinese: 人們是否認爲他在騙人？一直如此。

definition: don't tell me .../could it be that...?
to cheat/to swindle/to deceive/to get on (a horse etc) by swinging one leg over
that's right/sure!/rest assured!/that's good/can't go wrong
mythical horse/Internet slang for 什麼|什么[shen2 me5]
to talk drivel/to make irresponsible remarks
right or wrong?/Is it right?/OK, yes? (colloquial)
to think (i.e. to take it to be true that ...) (Usually there is an implication that the notion is mistaken – except when expressing one's own current opinion.)
see 沒關係|没关系[mei2 guan1 xi5]
hard to say/unpleasant to say/can't be sure
